result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:14 AM 
Defendant Daniel J Durrant in court.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Daniel J Durrant.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Pfeil calls the case and states appearances.
Matter scheduled for pre-trial, as well as a bond modification motion hearing.
Court notes that there was no bond modification hearing scheduled.
Atty Renc makes statements regarding the modification of bond.
ADA Pfeil notes that the state does not object to the motion.
Court questions Atty Renc regarding the modifications being proposed.
Victim is present and wishes to make a statement.
Victim K.D. makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:
Bond modified to allow the no contact condition to be waivable.
Victims will need to submit a family safety plan, if they want it to be waived.

Parties indicate there is nothing further to address.
Defendant Record Update

records.addlTxt: Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed by Atty Anne Renc
Defendant's Request for Substitution of Judge filed by Atty Anne Renc

3:31 PM Defendant Daniel J Durrant in court.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Daniel J Durrant.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, the court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Atty Renc notes she just today filed a substitution request but it does not appear to have been received by the clerk yet.  
Court will set the matter for pre-trial but that date will change when the new judge is assigned. 

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.
Arraignment scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Anne Renc

No contact with K.L.D., N.M.D., M.C. or the residence address as stated in court, or the mother's place of employment. This condition is non-waivable.
Defendant will be allowed one visit to the residence to pick up belongings with law enforcement.
Text contact allowed only at the number stated in court. This number will be given to the defendant in writing at the jail.

11:10 AM Defendant Daniel Jay Durrant appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kelly Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 

ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct, Misdemeanor Battery, Physical Abuse of a Child, Strangulation and Suffocation. 
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $1500 bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Cassidy makes bond arguments and notes that the victims are present to make a statement.
Victims make statements in regards to bond. 
Atty Bergner requests a signature bond and makes arguments.

Court makes statements.
Court questions ADA Cassidy regarding conditions.

11:36 AM UDAR STOPS
Hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
